channel.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
channel.description:
I have some problems with my computer. I cannot boot Windows 7 or Vista.
The problem started when I was launching FTL (a game). My screen freezed and the sound looped. I restarted my computer (With power button) and when I rebooted Windows 7 I got a BSOD at the end of the boot process and my computer instantly rebooted without being able to read anything of the BSOD.
When I try to boot Vista, it doesn`t work either, and when I try to use a Windows 7 install DVD, nothing happens when I choose install. The partition menu doesn`t come up.
I might get this covered where I bought it, but I don`t want to wait two weeks for them to repair it.
Does anyone know whats wrong? I`m able to run Ubuntu and Mint live CD. So it isn`t completely fucked.

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

Bowser jr:

Classic: Moparisthebest.com/smf is a graveyard. But SilentCJ could help me (He was just too late). So it was not wrong of me to post it here.

forums live through the irc

try there

Read full topic

I’m quite happy that the HDD was the problem, now I has to buy a new one. (Double the size, and increase the speed).

item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Storm Powner:

i had that too once it’s or the hdd that’s corrupt or your ram

The fact that he can still boot by USB or CD into a live CD pretty much tells you it’s the HDD and nothing else… that’s just basic hardware diagnostics.

item.source: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

It was only one partition that was borked. I marked it as hidden with gPart. I was then able to install Windows 7 on another partition. I’ve ordered a new harddrive from the web, and will replace my old one when I get it.

I will NOT use my old one as external since it isn’t safe. But you’re most likely correct, I would also blame the partition table.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Hard drive definitely sounds like the problem, before you declare it dead though, firstly, see if the drive is detected in Ubuntu, and if so, can you access the contents of it? Second, try a full format using the gparted application, delete the partitions and delete the partition table, create a new partition table and format the new partition as a primary ntfs partition then see if you can install Windows.

If it does work then hey, you could buy an external drive caddy for like £3 and then use it as an external hard drive

Read full topic
item.source: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I’ve decided to buy a new hard drive, as my old one is old and I think that might be a part of the problem. It might take some time for me to test it, so if you have any theories what else can be the problem, please tell me.

And don’t bother with any software related, only hardware.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:13, topic:461408”]Is there anyway for me to confirm or disprove that the hard drive is the cause? And no, I`m not able to test with another drive to check it. (If not an external disc could do the job.)

Because that is a thing I want to change anyway.[/quote]
The fact that you can run other disks or usb’s, is the weird thing.
I have no clue anymore what the problem could be because of that, all I can come up with is that your installation cd is broken
or that you have some kind of weird windows orientated new virus.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:11, topic:461408”]I bought the PC from the web, and last time they fucked with my PS2 emulator, not wiping out anything. And I have started that game lots of times, and I had no trouble running it.

And I know that the game isnt the cause because it is a hardware problem, not software. Avast! did not complain at all, and was most certainly not edited in anyway as it didt need to be cracked.

Im not made of money, so I dont want to waste it on a high cost technician.[/quote]
mine does fixes everything for 50$ doesnt mather how long it takes, lol.
Soon i’ll be fixing everything myself since i’m learning for pc technician

Read full topic

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I bought the PC from the web, and last time they fucked with my PS2 emulator, not wiping out anything. And I have started that game lots of times, and I had no trouble running it.

And I know that the game isnt the cause because it is a hardware problem, not software. Avast! did not complain at all, and was most certainly not edited in anyway as it didt need to be cracked.

Im not made of money, so I dont want to waste it on a high cost technician.

item.title: Windows won't boot, won't reinnstall. Harddrive problem. (Semi-solved)
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:

Bowser jr:

Yes I did download it from an unofficial source, but that isn`t the reason.

How do you know that?
Also did you meet the requirements, wouldn’t be the first computer that gives up due not being able to run something.
but you wouldn’t be able to run anything then

I’d suggest contacting a computer technician, (don’t go to the store, they wipe out all your stuff and it takes ages)
